td.p: The URI to the model which will be processed. If this isn't specified then the maven.andromda.src.dir and maven.andromda.src.includes properties will be used.

tr.td: Yes, unless maven.andromda.model.uri is NOT defined.

td.p: Defines the model(s) to process where n can be any number of models to process. n begins with 0. (i.e. maven.andromda.model.uri.0=file:${basedir}/path/to/some/model/model.xml). NOTE: defining maven.andromda.model.uri is the same as defining maven.andromda.model.uri.0.
The AndroMDA source directory (where any model files to be processed will be found). Default is ${maven.src.dir}/uml.
What model files to include from from the maven.andromda.src.dir. Default is *.xmi,*.xml.
Whether or not to perform a check if the model file(s) was modified since the last run occurred. Default is true.
Whether or not to process all packages of the model. Default is true.

tr.td: The name of the model package to either process or ignore, where n can be any number of packages to process. n begins with 0. (i.e. maven.andromda.modelPackage.0.name=org.andromda.metafacades.uml)
True/false on whether or not the package specified from the maven.andromda.modelPackage.n.name property should be processed (i.e. maven.andromda.modelPackage.0.shouldProcess=false).

Specifies a path to search when looking for modules used from your model specified by maven.andromda.model.uri, where n can be any number of paths to search, n starts with 0. (i.e. maven.andromda.repository.moduleSearchPath.location.0=${basedir}/../../metafacades/uml/common/src/uml)

Specifies whether or not models loaded by AndroMDA will be validated. Sometimes its nice to turn off validation for performance reasons (i.e. you have very large model(s) being processed). Default is true.
Specifies whether or not AndroMDA should fail on model validation errors. Default is false.
The URI to the input model. If this isn't provided, you'll be prompted to enter it.
The schema user name. If this isn't provided, you'll be prompted to enter it.
The schema user's password. If this isn't provided, you'll be prompted to enter it.
The connection URL for the database (i.e. jdbc:oracle:thin:@youroraclehost:1521:yoursid). If this isn't provided, you'll be prompted to enter it.
The class name for the JDBC driver. (i.e. oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver). If this isn't provided, you'll be prompted to enter it.
The URI to the mappings file, which maps SQL types (and JDBC types) to model types.
The location to which the output model will be written. Default is ${maven.build.dir}/schema2xmi/transformed.xmi.
Specifies the name of the package to which the model classes will be added. If not specified classes are added directly to the model itself.

A regular expression pattern for limiting the number of tables matched when reading the schema. (i.e. [\p{Lower}\p{Upper}[_]]* will match all table names having upper or lower case letters, and containing underscores.
A schema name; must match the schema name as it is stored in the database. If you do not specifiy it then it will not be used to narrow the table search.
A comma seperated list of stereotype(s) to add to the generated model classes. Default is Entity.
A comma seperated list of stereotype(s) to add to the generated model class identifiers. Default is PrimaryKey.
The table name tagged value to add to the generated model classes.
The colum name tagged value to add to the generated model class attributes.

subsection.name: Ignoring Namespace properties
subsection.p: You may want to "ignore" property definitions at some point when using a cartridge. For example: this comes in handy when a cartridge has a certain template set to required and yet you don't want to generate anything from that template. In that case you can add an "ignore" prefix to a property definition (i.e. <ignore.entity-impls/>) and AndroMDA will safely ignore that property.
